name: Gallic Wars: Violens Annalis
description:
It was the year 58 B.C.

In this year, a new governor arrived in Gaul.
He was the Consul of the previous year and a renowned figure in the winds of Roman politics.

His name was Gaius Julius Caesar.

With great ambition in his heart, Caesar came to this land.

Simple command system

A simple command system with one command per turn.
The simple rules make it easy to play.

Chapter-based campaign structure

The story progresses by achieving chapter goals.
The game is over if the goal is not achieved, so the game progresses without getting dull.

Various sub-stories

A variety of sub-stories are told by each tribe.
Early on, stories about Helvetii and Sequani unfold.
Later on, stories about the Germani and Britanni, who are powerful enemies, will also unfold.
Each time you play, the story will unfold differently.
